summary: The Prior Approval Reform Act (H.R. 1399) aims to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. The bill eliminates restrictions on the ability of trade associations to solicit contributions from stockholders and executive/administrative personnel of member corporations. Effectively, it removes the requirement for prior approval in certain solicitation activities. The amendment made by the subsection (a) shall apply to solicitations made on or after January 1, 2025.
